result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Nigel Longino

records.addlTxt:
1:05 PM Defendant Marcus Nigel Longino not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Marcus Nigel Longino.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin. All matters called today.  DE was transported to DCI from Dane County.  Defendant not transported today.  Attorney Hayes request more time to have defendant transported.  Info received.  Court resets matters.  OTP will be needed for DCI.
Arraignment scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:14 AM Defendant Marcus Nigel Longino in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Marcus Nigel Longino.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3. Set over for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus Nigel Longino in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Marcus Nigel Longino.  Court states cases and appearances.  21CM601 is a Br 3 case - Atty Hayes stands mute.  21CM644 is a Br 1 case - Atty Hayes asks that the case be recalled as DE would like a chance to request substitution.  22CF148 is a Br 3 case - Atty Hayes requests a PH.  State to do an OTP for the PH in 22CF148.  CM cases to track for RD at the same date and time.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

He was given signature bonds on each case, which he has refused to sign.  Will advise Dane County to place a hold for us on our cases, in the event he clears up his cases with them/qualifies for release.

Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Return date on July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:10 PM Defendant Marcus Nigel Longino in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Marcus Nigel Longino in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaints.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing in 22CF148.  Bonds set.  All matters to track.  Court orders any warrants quashed if they are still in effect.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

21CM644 - $500.00 signature bond set - RD on 7/7/2022 at 1pm in Br 1
21CM601 - $500.00 signature bond set - RD on 7/19/22 at 1pm
22CF148 - $2,000.00 signature bond set - RD on 76/19/22 at 1pm

Special bond conditions in all matters as follows:  Booking today.
